Document.name: Israel National Trail
Document.description: The green line showing the trail's approximate route was not drawn by me - I got it from hike.co.il via Wikipedia. If you zoom in pretty far, Google Maps also includes a faint, gray line which follows the route of the trail! I added all the blue markers and blue line sections showing where I stayed each night, sections I skipped, and other relevant things. I hope this helps people visualize the trail and my progress along it.

Placemark.name: Begin Day 3 (Shkhoret Night Camp - Approximate location)
End Day 9 - From here, we hitchhiked to Tsihor Junction
I hiked this section during our break to make up for part of what I'd missed
Begin Day 17 (Geve Hava Night Camp - approximate location)
Begin Day 19 (Hod Akev Night Camp - approximate location)
Avdat, which I visited on Day 21
Sde Boker, home of David Ben-Gurion in his later years, which I toured on Day 21
This is the section we skipped :(
This is the section we skipped :(
Begin Day 27 (Wadi near Dvira - approximate location)
This is part of the Valley of Elah" (might be translated "Valley of the Terebinth" in your Bible)ey of the Terebinth" in your Bible)
From here, I began hitchiking on Day 34)
I hitchhiked this part because it was all along a major highway.
Somewhere in this general vicinity is where I stopped hiking on Day 35 (HaYarkon Park, Tel Aviv)
We stayed in Zichron Ya'akov the night of Day 40)
Alon Valley, my official favorite place in the Middle East
This part of the Israel Trail overlaps with the Jesus Trail
I skipped this part. I'd walked it before. 0/10 would not hike again.
We stopped hiking here on Day 55
We skipped this part. It was probably really nice.
From Meron, I hitchhiked to Jish and back for groceries. This is where Idan left me.
This is the valley I was overlooking, thinking it looked like Virginia.
Begin Day 57 (Har Bar-Yohai, 1151m, highest point in Israel proper)
At this point, I was tempted to keep on walking straight and see how close I could get to the Lebanese border.
End of Day 60 and the Trail
Nimrod, where I volunteered for a month
